comment: He is the BEST professor at Kennesaw State! He very passionate with his lecture as he makes complex political ideas and current events engaging and easy to understand. He encourages critical thinking, fosters open discussions. HE GENUINALLY CARES about his students' success. His teaching style is clear, well-organized, and thought-provoking
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Inspirational

comment: Lenny is the BEST. 3rd sem with him so far (all As). Take him in person if you can its so much better, online is alright. Lenny is so experienced and has lots of INSANE stories to tell. Expect about 2 tests and a paper or two in his classes. Lectures old school and I love it, no powerpoints just a whiteboard and his voice. pls TAKE NOTES, SHOW UP.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Respected--Lecture heavy

comment: Lenny is by far one of my favorite teachers at KSU. His lectures are super personal and he has so much life experience and tells great stories that relate to the content we learn in class. There are very few (but decently big) assignments/tests, but they are pretty straight forward if you simply attend class take notes and use the study guide.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Inspirational

comment: I normally make all A's with everything I ever turn in but his tests were a bit confusing because many of the questions did not make sense. Still, I made a final grade of A but there is very little to be graded on and it's only a part - time gig for him so he does not have the time to make the class well structured for grades.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Koltochnik is one of the best online instructors I've had. 2 exams and 3 papers, plus no discussion posts or required textbook, his approach prioritizes lectures. While lectures can be dense, they're concise, and sometimes he'll provide handouts and maps. His lectures are all you need for exams and papers. Would definitely take him again.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Lecture heavy

comment: The best. Easy, opinion based essays that he grades VERY easily (basically everyone got 100s if they tried). Midterm and final weren't hard and were open note, but def took awhile to complete. Lots of lecture videos, but he is very passionate and entertaining. We did submit most assignments through email which was odd - But overall he is great.

Easy A. Had 5 assignments, 2 tests and three homework essay's. As long as you watch his lecture videos you'll get an A. Question on the exams are literally word for word from what he says in his lecture videos so take detailed notes.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor! We had to watch lectures, take notes, and read handouts. Make sure to take notes because much of what he says is on the mid-term and final. We had 3 assignments throughout the semester which were 3 easy papers, about 3-4 pages in length. I would take him for an easy A if you put in the effort to take notes and watch the lectures.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Good professor who wants you to succeed. There were 3 essays that were 3-4 pages each and a midterm and a final that were not cumulative. My essays were not amazing, just fine and I got a 100% on every single one. The tests are a bit hard but doable if you listen carefully to all the lectures, and there's a lot of those.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Very few assignments, take notes and you'll do good
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: There are three essays and two exams. There is no busy work to complete, just watch the lectures and you will be fine. He is a great teacher and loves his job, definitely take him if you prefer more laid back teachers.
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Professor Koltochnik was amazing! His lectures were very engaging and interesting. Assignments were clearly stated and easy/quick to do. He was not biased regarding the information being taught and simply presented the information for you to form your own opinion.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Super funny guy and a very informative class - I learned sooo much!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: This professor is awesome. There are a lot of lectures but he is very helpful during exams, and you can use lectures and notes for them as well. All of his answers are in the information he gives us.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Inspirational--Caring

comment: Great overall professor. Very lecture heavy but if you pay attention and take good notes, you'll do just fine. Funny and amusing professor. One of the best professors I've had at KSU so far. If your struggling, work with him and he will work with you. No question about it, take this professor.
rating_tags: Respected--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: He is a good teacher. Makes the class really interesting. The only complaint I have is that he doesnt put grades in d2l. So you literally have no idea how youre doing in the class until the end. Its annoying but if youre okay with that then he is a good teacher to take.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Honestly my favorite professor. He has real life experience, has traveled the world and wants to see you succeed. Show up, study the lecture notes and you will get an A. Truly an outstanding professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Lenny was a nice guy and had interesting lectures. You only have a mid term and a final, and three very easy take home assignments. He also records lectures, but I would just watch them in real-time because sometimes only half of the videos got uploaded. Exams were a little wonky, but if you took notes you'd do fine.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Lenny is a decent professor. My only concern with his class was that there were only 5 assignments. 3 homework assignments that equaled 30% of your grade. The midterm is 35% of your grade, and the final is also 35% of your grade. His exams are difficult because multiple answer choices are correct but you have to find the one that is the best.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Koltochnik definitely has pros and cons: Pros- Nice guy, understandable lectures, very knowledgeable, always willing to help, & a clear rubric. Cons- His test are very opinionated and can be troubling. Hed have questions with multiple correct answers and would have questions that werent fully covered or they were vague. I hope he fixes his exams
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take this class (especially online) unless you want to literally spend hours on a study guide for him to openly use opinionated questions in his mid term and final. He does not respect his students and is extremely rude when they ask for help. Everything is opinion based and if you care about keeping all A's do not take this course.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: very easy class. i dont know anything really about the government but he breaks it down very well. tests are oddly specific so you need to take good notes.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Good class. Enjoyable. Lenny Koltochnik did well in class. However, when COVID-19 caused this class to go from 100% classroom to 100% online, he gave reading assignments via email. That's it. We never met virtually, which I think was a mistake. I would give him a higher rating if he used D2L. Nowhere could you see your grades. 2 absences allowed

Lenny is a great guy who doesn't take himself too seriously, yet he is full of stories and dad jokes. He doesn't ask for much outside of showing up and paying attention. Very inspirational and one of my top three favorite professors.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Inspirational--Hilarious

comment: This professor is passionate about his job and gives you the tools you need to succeed. There are a couple tests, a research paper, and a presentation about that research. He is very knowledgeable about the subject matter, old school in his teaching methods, and entertaining in his lectures. You should take this class.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things

comment: He's a good guy that likes to make people laugh. Pretty easy class. You have to go to every class because he only lectures (no powerpoints) but they're always good and he usually lets everyone leave early. The 10-page research paper isn't too bad either. The midterm multiple choice is oddly specific but nonetheless I highly recommend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: His class is two exams and two papers. His exams are weirdly specific and I found the midterm difficult and I showed up to every class and always do well on my exams. Our final was cancelled due to the corona virus so we did a third essay but he said the final was usually easier than the midterm. I like him as a person and enjoyed his class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Tough grader

comment: Lenny is the best professor!!! He is funny and his lectures are GREAT!!! He is not boring and he loves to help his students. We spent many classes talking about jobs and opportunities after school, not just about the next test. You'll have a mid term, a 12 page paper, a final and attendance as your grade... I CANNOT STRESS THIS ENOUGH! TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Global Issues with Professor Koltochnik was one of the highlights of my sophomore year. He's a great teacher and cares very much about his students and what he teaches. His classes are based entirely around lectures but he delivers the material in a way that is easy to handle for students. He assigned 2 tests and 2 papers which weren't difficult.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: I took Koltochnik because he had great reviews on rate my professor. DEFINITELY take him. He just lectures, but he makes it interesting and funny. He loves his jokes about vodka. Your grade is based on 3 papers, 2 tests, and attendance. He provides detailed study guides for the tests and the final is noncumulative. If you study, it's an easy A.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: He usually lectures for 30-40 minutes and lets class out. Dont buy textbook. Very funny and understanding but do not take him if youre a bad test taker. Grades on attendance, 2 papers, mid term and the final. Questions were very specific and sometimes hard to understand
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Best professor I have ever had for sure! Great lectures and good study guides! Only 2 tests, the midterm and final exam.  You will need to attend this class. Completely understanding and caring man. Should be anybodys first choice if taking this class!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Inspirational--Caring

comment: Great teacher! If you get confused just ask he will explain! Attendance is mandatory you're allowed to miss two classes only. you have two writing assignments (they are easy), your midterm and final for your grade. He lectures for one hour. Just pay attention and you'll be fine in the class. Overall he's a great teacher very funny 10/10 recommend!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: BEST PROFESSOR IN POLS. I'm serious. Do not pass up the opportunity to take his class. He is an extremely nice guy, and pretty funny. His class is extremely lecture heavy (in fact, that's all he does) but he makes the lectures interesting. No book needed, just take notes. It's not super easy, but it's very doable if you follow his guidance.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Super nice professor with a lot of knowledge on the subject and experience in the field. The only grades were a midterm, a final, a paper and attendance. Take him for his jokes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This professor is absolutely brilliant. The class is lecture heavy, but he makes it interesting with jokes and anecdotes. Only 5(?) grades, 3 papers, a midterm, and a final. You get an A on the papers if you complete the page requirement and express your own thoughts. Class was dismissed early often.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: What an amazing professor. He is extremely knowledgeable with an impressive background in International Relations. He is very approachable and will help you with any questions. Attendance is mandatory which isn't an issue because his lectures are easy to listen to. He even cracks a few dad jokes here and there. DON'T PROCRASTINATE ON THE PAPERS!!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Lenny is a great guy. His class is lecture heavy, but he tries to make them interesting. The tests are pretty lecture specific. I never read the book, so you don't need it. I used to make A's and B's on my history test, but I made a C on his midterm. I'm not very good at test though. 30% midterm, 15% attendance, 35% final, and 20% on three papers.
rating_tags: Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Would take again

comment: Funniest teacher I've ever had, really enjoyed going to his class. Write down all the notes and don't procrastinate on the 3 papers and it's an easy A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Would take again

comment: NICEST TEACHER I'VE EVER HAD. Very caring and likes to make us laugh. Very very very few assignments. This class will not take up much of your time plus he usually lets out about 20 minutes early. Honestly nothing bad I could say about him, I would 100% take again. No book that you have to purchase, study for the 2 tests and you should get an A.
rating_tags: Respected--Hilarious--Caring

comment: Lenny is a great guy and an awesome professor. I don't even mind going to class, he makes it interesting and funny. Knows his stuff. Go to class, pay attention, and you should have no issues making an A. Wish he taught higher level courses!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Let's face it, US Government is not very exciting and though the material is dry Lenny made it interesting, throwing in jokes and stories that helped to make the material more enjoyable. Be sure to take good notes and show up for every class and you'll do good. Required assignments: 3 papers (3-4 pages) and 2 tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: If you pay attention in class and take notes you should be fine. Be sure to write down the key points that he brings up and it should be an easy A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Take lecture notes, you wont need a text book but lecture notes will be important. He does study guides and review sessions before the exams. Makes a few comments that are indirectly offensive but I'm pretty sure he isn't aware of it. I did very well in the class. Attendance is important. I took International Relations

Don't buy the textbook you don't use it. Easy A. For the essays on the midterm and final just write a lot in length and you will be fine. Tests ridiculously easy. Hilarious Ukrainian dude, loves vodka jokes. If you don't take him you're an idiot. Very knowledgeable and was recruited by DIA if I remember correctly
rating_tags: Hilarious--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Very laidback , likes to tell a lot of jokes. He does not use PowerPoints however, was difficult to get use to at first but i think it helped me learn the material having to actually write things down he put on the board. 2 test and 3 assignments, fairly easy.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lenny is straight forward on what he wants. 2 tests and a paper do not make it easy for all, though. He'll pop jokes about Vodka(he's Ukrainian w/ almost no accent), so be prepared. You must go to class because essentially all of his tests are from lectures. I personally didn't even unwrap the textbook. The most daunting thing is by far the essay.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Such a great professor!! He is funny and the lectures are really straightforward. You do have to go to class because the tests are mainly from the lectures. There is a midterm, a final, and 3 short papers (you will get 100 if you do the paper). Also, he does give out a study guide for the midterm and final. Just go to class and take decent notes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Great Professor! There is no reason you should fail. Very organized class, lectures are interesting, corny dad jokes, few painless papers. His tests are his exact lectures so go to class and write it all down! Nothing impossible, you should get an A. He's a lovable teddy bear lol just take the class

Lenny is the best professor at KSU. He is very clear with his expectations. He teaches because he loves it and will do whatever he can to help you. If you show up and put forth an effort you will pass. He gives points for attendance. I have taken 3 of his classes. His tests come directly from lectures. GREAT PROFESSOR!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Great lectures- on what needs to be covered- doesn't waste your time. Attendance is mandatory (15%). No need for the book- he tells you what's on each test (Midterm 30%, Final 35% non-cumulative). Gives study guides for both. Research paper 12-15 pages (20%). Very knowledgeable and has the experience to back up his lectures.
GREAT teacher, he loves what he does, he makes class interesting and does short lectures. The papers are nothing, just do the length and you'll get a 100. Test can be tricky so STUDY!

Professor Koltchnik made me like history/government. I've had such boring professors in these classes before, but he actually made it interesting. He extremely knowledgeable/passionate about everything he talks about. Midterm and final, 3 take home assignments. Take good notes and study and you'll get at least a B. He's got funny "dad jokes," too.

GREAT TEACHER!  I missed classes but still got a B Try your best to NOT miss class! He puts an outline of the lecture on the board before class, write it all down, take good notes, you'll pass! His class is organized, the study guides will be easy if you're organized too and kept those outlines and good notes. Few papers, nothing hard!

Dr. Lenny is the absolute man. Easily one of the biggest cake walks of class I've ever taken... The only reason I didn't make an A was my own fault. I took him for Intro to Comparative Politics. It was very informative and interesting!  Just show up to class (every class) and take good notes. If you don't show up, expect to do poorly on tests.

Lenny is hands down the best professor I've ever had. He is extremely knowledgeable about the material and does a great job of breaking it down so you know what you are expected to know. Go to class, pay attention, do what he expects and you'll be fine. His lectures are enjoyable and he truly cares about his student's success. 10/10.

Lenny is the best. He only lectures for an hour, and he gives really specific study guides for tests which are only the midterm and final. You have to study kinda hard for those since they make up like 80% of your grade, but he also curves them. Class isn't boring, I really don't mind going. Like someone said, if you don't take Lenny, you're dumb.
Only lectures for an hour, tons of vodka jokes, easy papers, study guides, and clear lecturing. No textbook needed. Lenny is great. If you don't take him you're dumb.

Hi everybody, i got Professor Lenny Koltochnik for my POLS 1101 Class and he is a really good teacher. Because of him i now love politics. His class is so interesting and the test are straight forward from the notes. He gave you study guides and crack jokes. Seriously he is the best Teacher EVER. take him. Easy A. 2 tests and four 1 page paper.

Lenny is the kind of professor that you can't help but love.  His lectures are extremely clear and informative. He knows his shop. He will keep you entertained with his jokes. Nobody even dropped his class, I've never seen that and its my 4th year.  Two tests, 4 essays, show up and you'll pass.  His tests may be hard for those who can't "read".

I took this class in the Winter semester. He is a very great teacher. I got a c in the class. I could got an A easy, but I was working two jobs, and I did not have time to study. I did horrible in the first test, but he gave the ones who did bad in the first test feedback on how to success. He is easy to understand. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND HIM.

Lenny was a very good and knowledgeable professor. You will never be bored. Even through the boring parts of history, he makes it very interesting. There are only 2 tests (midterm and final) worth 25% and 30% of your grade. Attendance counts but you are allotted two absenses. 3 or 4 writing assignments. I did not buy the textbook and was fine.

Amazing teacher! He tries to be tons of fun to keep you from falling asleep. Book is optional but not really needed. He doesn't believe in quizzes & gives you study guide of what'll come exactly in the test which you can get from your class notes. Each test does require you to write a small essay about a question he'll note in the guide. Love him!

Great Professor. He takes attendance. He explains everything so easily and in depth. He is willing to help in any way possible. When i had him he would only lecture for 1 hour and let us out early every class. he would stick around in case anyone had any questions. We had to write 4 papers but they extremely easy to write. TAKE HIM!!
Lenny is a good professor and really funny.  Class is easy if you attend and take notes. TAKE HIM!
Best teacher you could possibly take for this course. His jokes are hilarious, I look forward to his classes just for that. He's easy.. I don't have the strength to spell it all out, TAKE HIM!!!!

Lenny is a great professor. He knows what he is talking about and he doesn't include his own personal beliefs. No homework. he wants the students to read the chapters. Midterm and Final, nothing cumulative. And 4 papers due that are simple and easy, graded very easily. Would Recommend!

I think Mr. Lenny's class was worth taking if you come to every class because only two test that come right from your notes.  He is a funny guy and very helpful if you ask him any questions.  I had to spend a lot of time studying for the mid-term and final but did very well you will have to put in time because EVERYTHING covered in class is on test

I was pleasantly surprised with how much I liked this class. Lenny makes jokes and tells stories to make the class fun. I struggled a little with the notes because he writes them on the board instead of using power point. Other than that, if you write the assigned papers and study for the test you will do fine in his class.

Lenny is a very nice guy! The class overall is very challenging if you are a visual learner. He only lectures no PowerPoints or anything. His tests are straight from the notes. He will help you out if you ask for help, but only grades are final, midterm, attendance and 4 writing assignments. MUST TAKE GOOD NOTES!

Great professor.  Really nice guy, very helpful and genuinely wants his students to do well.  Take good notes, understand the concepts and do the assignments.  He's more than fair.  I really enjoyed his class and his jokes :)
Very Good Professor. Pay attention to notes. Test is reasonable. No textbook needed. Exams are based on lectures. Good class and enjoyable.

Lenny is so nice and is always willing to help his students. You are allowed to miss 2 classes but you  shouldn't becasue everything comes straight from the notes. He also povides study handouts that list everything you need to know along with the essay questions he's going to ask. Not to mention half the exams are matching! Lenny's awesome!
